p: Our study showed that the content of linolenic, 5-octadecenoic, stearic, palmitic, and oleic acids in the tested oil was 53.21, 18.66, 2.92, 7.18, and 4.94%, respectively, which is in agreement with the literature data [ 13]. Additionally, an unknown compound was visible in the chromatogram with a retention time of 13.3 min, which was probably cis-5-hexadecenoic acid, as suggested by the mass of the molecular ion and literature [ 13]. Our research showed that C. acaulis oil also contained myristic, palmitoleic, margaric, 8-octadecenoic, 9,12-octadecadienoic, arachidic, alpha-linolenic, 11,14,17-eicosatrienoic, and mangiferic acids and one unidentified compound (retention time 15.49 min).
